intro: Asystasia drake-brockmanii var. typica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved asystasia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or violet in color, arranged in whorled clusters. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
